title.rendered: Is the third time a charm for Manchester United against The Blues? Liverpool still the real deal

content.rendered:
The drive for clubs to succeed in the second half of the season is in full swing with only a few months left on the top European football calendar. In all honesty, it has been a subdued January transfer window with most clubs having a preference for the summer window. Borussia Dortmund got a potentially sweet deal when they acquired the highly rated Erling Haaland who has already bagged seven goals in three matches.

The Premier League has been on a winter break, the first of its kind in an updated system of reforms to keep the league fresh and interesting. Speaking of interesting, who ever thought that Liverpool would be this dominant? Last season, they were good, really good in fact. However, they have grown and evolved to be an unstoppable force. 24 wins from 25 matches are truly astonishing. This season, they have taken all comers, with the only glitch being held to a frustrating draw at Old Trafford by Manchester United. The Manchester based club made some moves in the January window in a bid to salvage their season. Bruno Fernandez was the highest profile signing in the Premier League, joining United in a deal worth around 55m Euros (£47m) but add-ons could as well increase the overall cost to 80m euros (£67.7m). They also added Nigerian international Odion Ighalo on loan from Chinese club Shanghai Shenhua who reportedly took a pay cut to put on a United shirt.

United next visit Stamford Bridge to face rivals Chelsea. Both teams have played young players in their matches. Surprisingly, bookies from William Hill fancy the Blues to win this one and that is why they have Chelsea at 1.83 to win against United’s 4.33. United have won 3 of the last 5 meetings between the two sides, the last being a 2-1 win in a cup tie. 12BET have an amazing deal for new players only. The first step is to place 6 bets each with a minimum stake of £10. If any of the 6 qualifying bets is over £35 it will only count as the £35 maximum and count towards 1 of the 6 qualifying bets.

Football and sports generally have transcended the gamer experience. Many fans and gamers alike are in a position to take chance on various sports that they fancy. They may not be able to play the game, but they can join in the action from behind the scenes. This aspect of gaming has been a global phenomenon for example, the best online pokies by nz casinos give gamers a chance to learn the craft and grow their winnings.

Maybe you want to explore the thrill of gaming in a simple way, casino games in Sweden is a good first step. For the ultimate experience in gaming diversity, you could explore ElitCasinon best online list. Speaking of diversity, the Premier League clubs moved to ensure that the next summer transfer window will close on September 1st. They voted to revert to this system because of the need to give teams more time to get deals over the line. The recent two summer windows have seen some clubs run out of time, as it would close at mid-August latest. With profitability at its highest due to TV rights deals, it remains to be seen whether or not this will help English football clubs get more players in. Traditional heavyweights Manchester United and Arsenal are no longer the attractive destinations they used to be due to performances.

League leaders Liverpool are on cloud nine as they march towards a first Premier League title in 30 years. No team this season seems to have an answer for them. As of the Premier League winter break, the Merseyside club had notched an astonishing 24 wins from 25 matches. After the 2-0 loss against Tottenham Hotspur in their last match, Pep Guardiola admitted that Liverpool are unstoppable and conceded defeat in the race for the title.

Can this side get even better? Well in football, there is always room for improvement. In their case, Liverpool indeed can add more fire power with none of their front three being out and out strikers. There have been reports of Kylian Mbappe possibly joining the Reds in the future. However, the stumbling block in such a move which has a huge price tag is that Liverpool would have to let go of their biggest name; Mohammed Salah.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Jose Mourinho says Romelu Lukaku's form amazing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho hailed the "amazing" goalscoring efforts of Romelu Lukaku, but says it is only possible with a good team around him. Lukaku took his tally to 10 in his first nine matches with two goals in the 4-1 win at CSKA Moscow in the Champions League group stage…
